intro: Leucadendron grandiflorum, commonly known as the silver curlew, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage and large, showy yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters, making it a notable addition to gardens and landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
